Title:
(New) Phylogenetic relationships within Lachnaceae
(Ascomycota): Laevipulum, Erioscyphella, and species within Capitotricha
bicolor
Abstract:
Sequences of Capitotricha bicolor from Quercus, Fagus
sylvatica, Alnus alnobetula, and Nothofagus, and C. rubi from Rubus
idaeus, all from central Europe, were obtained from apothecia to
establish whether specimens from different hosts belong to separate
species. The obtained ITS1-5.8S-ITS2 rDNA sequences were examined by
Bayesian and parsimony phylogenetic analyses. Intra- and interspecific
variation was also investigated based on molecular distances in the ITS
region. The phylogenetic analyses supported the specific distinctness of
Capitotricha rubi and Capitotricha from Nothofagus, but suggest also
specific distinctness among samples from Quercus, Fagus, and Alnus. The
interspecific absolute distances were larger than intraspecific absolute
distances for all examined units. The smallest absolute distance was
found between “Alnus alnobetula” and “Fagus sylvatica” units.
Phyllogenetic relationships within Brunnipila are discussed and two new
sequences of Brunnipila are published. Capitotricha, Lachnum and
Erioscyphella are compared to each other based on hair and excipulum
characteristics.
